page.title: 03PROVISION FOR LEARNING
page.content: There is no formal provision for Nursery Education & no Playgroup in Deanston but children can attend the latter in Doune or Thornhill. Primary pupils from Deanston attend a village school which was once provided by the Cotton Mill owners. Now it is a L.E.A. 2-teacher school with 39 pupils It has visiting specialist staff for P.E./Music/Needlework/Remedial Studies The children of the Rural area travel to either Doune or Thornhill for Primary education. When they reach Secondary School age all the pupils travel by bus to McLaren High School in Callander. This school has 750 pupils aged from 11\ to 18 years and has a catchment area of 16 small feeder schools. A good percentage of the pupils go on to Further Education at Universities or Colleges throughout the U.K.
